abstracts

Class QGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • abstracts.QGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    QGameSimple

    public abstract class QGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Simple thread. Creates everything necessary to run the game, and makes you implement things that are only needed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QGame()
      Main thread initialization.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QGame

        public QGame()
        Main thread initialization. Default width and height is 640 x 480 and full screen is false.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        protected abstract void setup()
        Initialise all of your Objects in here In our case we have our game object where we will do this

      • render

        protected abstract void render(java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Method where you paint to the screen.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics to which to draw images to.

      • update

        protected abstract void update(int deltaTime)
        Method that handles all the movements that are supposed to happen. So initialise all the x and y changes here. deltaTime tells you how many nanoseconds have passed by since this function was last called.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - how much time has passed since last time update was called.

      • keyPressed

        public abstract void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        All the keyboard presses will be registered here.
        Parameters:
        e - What key the user has pressed.

      • keyReleased

        public abstract void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        All the keyboard releases will be registered here.
        Parameters:
        e - Which key the user has released.

      • mouseEntered

        public abstract void mouseEntered(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        If mouse has entered into the window. Quote useless but I am giving this lesson nonetheless.
        Parameters:
        e - Event which shows where the mouse has entered.

      • mousePressed

        public abstract void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        If user presses the mouse button.
        Parameters:
        e - All the info about which mouse button was pressed and where.

      • mouseMoved

        public abstract void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Mouse movement actions will go here.
        Parameters:
        e - Where the mouse is currently located.

      • run

        public void run()
        All the game logic is here. This function calls setup() first, and once the loop starts it will keep on calling draw and update alternatively.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • setScreen

        public void setScreen(int width,
             int height,
             boolean fullScreen)
        Sets screen to specified values.
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the screen/window.
        height - the height of the screen/window.
        fullScreen - if you do set it to true, please do make sure that width and height are correct parameters.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the game window.
        Returns:
        int which represents the width of this game window.

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of this game window.
        Returns:
        int which will represent the height of this game window.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title of this game window to what you specify,
        Parameters:
        title - Title of this game window/program.

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes everything by the specified values. You can call it right away, or call setScreen() method first.
